definitions.text: the quality of being at a refreshingly low temperature
great coolness and composure under strain

examples: The air cooled considerably after the thunderstorm

definitions.text: neither warm nor very cold; giving relief from heat
marked by calm self-control (especially in trying circumstances); unemotional
examples: the most nerveless winner in the history of the tournament

definitions.text: (color) inducing the impression of coolness; used especially of greens and blues and violets
examples: cool greens and blues and violets

definitions.text: psychologically cool and unenthusiastic; unfriendly or unresponsive or showing dislike
examples: cool to the idea of higher taxes

definitions.text: (used of a number or sum) without exaggeration or qualification
fashionable and attractive at the time; often skilled or socially adept
examples: it's not cool to arrive at a party too early
